title: Authors and Citation
text: Flora Le. Author, maintainer. Joshua F. Wiley. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Le F, Wiley J (2022). multilevelcoda: Estimate present multilevel compositional data analysis (CoDA). https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/, https://github.com/florale/multilevelcoda.
code: @Manual{,   title = {multilevelcoda: Estimate and present multilevel compositional data analysis (CoDA)},   author = {Flora Le and Joshua F. Wiley},   year = {2022},   note = {https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/, https://github.com/florale/multilevelcoda}, }

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the predictor. — brmcoda
code: brmcoda(formula, compilr, ...)

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the predictor. — brmcoda
text: formula object class formula, brmsformula: symbolic description model fitted. Details model specification can found brmsformula. compilr compilr object containing data composition, ILR coordinates, variables used model. ... arguments passed brm.

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the predictor. — brmcoda
text: list two elements CompIlr object class compilr used brm model. BrmModel object class brmsfit, contains posterior draws along many useful information model. function fits brm model -person within-person ILR coordinates predictor.  data(mcompd) data(sbp)## compute compositions ILR coordinates cilr <- compilr(data = mcompd, sbp = sbp, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"), idvar = "ID")## inspect names ILR coordinates bfore passing 'brm' model names(cilr$BetweenILR) names(cilr$WithinILR)## run brmcoda model # unadjusted model brmcodatest <- brmcoda(compilr = cilr,                 formula = STRESS ~ bilr1 + bilr2 + bilr3 + bilr4 + wilr1 + wilr2 + wilr3 + wilr4 + (1 | ID),                 core = 8, chain = 4)# adjusted model adjbrmcodatest <- brmcoda(compilr = cilr,                 formula = STRESS ~ bilr1 + bilr2 + bilr3 + bilr4 + wilr1 + wilr2 + wilr3 + wilr4 + Female + (1 | ID),                 core = 8, chain = 4) print(mcm$BrmModel)## clean-rm(mcompd, sbp, cilr, mcm, mcmc)

what: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
text: Estimate difference outcomes compositional variables substituted specific time period. -person level.

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
code: bsub(data, substitute, minute = 60L)

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
text: data brmcoda object contains results fitted brm model relevant inputs substitution model compilr. substitute data.frame data.table possible substitution variables. dataset can computed using function possub. Required. minute integer numeric value specifying minute compositional variable substituted /. Default 60L.

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
text: list results substitution models compositional variables.

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsub
code: data(mcompd) data(sbp) ps <- possub(data = mcompd, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"))  bsubtest <- bsub(data = mcm, substitute = ps, minute = 10) #> Error in isFALSE(identical(ncol(substitute), length(data$CompIlr$composition))): object 'mcm' not found  ## cleanup rm(bsubtest, mcompd) #> Warning: object 'bsubtest' not found #> Warning: object 'mcompd' not found

text: Estimate difference outcomes compositional variables substituted specific time period. -person level.

code: bsubc(data, substitute, minute = 60L)

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsubc
text: data brmcoda object contains results fitted brm model relevant inputs substitution model compilr. substitute data.frame data.table possible substitution variables. dataset can computed using function possub. Required. minute integer numeric value specifying minute compositional variable substituted /. Default 60L.

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsubc
text: list

title: Between-person Substitution Model (from sample's compositional mean) — bsubc
code: data(mcompd) data(sbp) ps <- possub(data = mcompd, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"))  bsubctest2 <- bsubc(data = mcmc, substitute = ps, minute = 10) #> Error in isFALSE(identical(ncol(substitute), length(data$CompIlr$composition))): object 'mcmc' not found  ## cleanup rm(bsubtest, mcompd, sbp, ps) #> Warning: object 'bsubtest' not found #> Warning: object 'mcompd' not found #> Warning: object 'sbp' not found

what: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
title: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
text: function estimates difference outcomes compositional variables substituted specific period -person level. model loops compositional variables present brmcoda object.

title: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
code: bsubmargins(data, substitute, minute = 60L)

title: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
text: data fitted brmcoda model data. Required. substitute data frame data table indicating possible substitution variables. dataset can computed using possub. Required. minute integer numeric value indicating maximum minute substitution model desired. Default 60L. case, model loops 1:60L minutes.

title: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
text: list containing result isotemporal multilevel substitution model. elements list corresspond compositional variable.

title: Average Margianl Effects of Between-person Isotemporal Substitution. — bsubmargins
code: ps <- possub(data = mcompd, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"))  bsmtestc <- bsubmargins(data = adjbrmcodatest, substitute = ps, minute = 2) #> Error in isFALSE(identical(ncol(substitute), length(data$CompIlr$composition))): object 'adjbrmcodatest' not found

what: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr
title: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr
text: function calculates sets compositions IRLs Multilevel Compositional Data models.

title: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr
code: compilr(data, sbp, composition, idvar = "ID")

title: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr
text: data data.frame data.table containing data variables used analysis. must include composition ID variable. Required. sbp signary matrix indicating sequential binary partition. Required. composition character vector specifying names compositional variables. Required. idvar character string specifying name variable containing IDs. Default ID.

title: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr
text: list eleven elements. BetweenComp vector class acomp representing one closed -person composition matrix class acomp representing multiple closed -person compositions one row. WithinComp vector class acomp representing one closed within-person composition matrix class acomp representing multiple closed within-person compositions one row. TotalComp vector class acomp representing one closed total composition matrix class acomp representing multiple closed total compositions one row. BetweenILR Isometric log ratio transform -person composition. WithinILR Isometric log ratio transform within-person composition. TotalILR Isometric log ratio transform total composition. data user's dataset imputed dataset input data contains zeros. psi ILR matrix associated user-defined partition structure. sbp user-defined sequential binary partition matrix. composition Names compositional variables. idvar Name variable containing IDs.

title: Compute Between-person, Within-person, and Total Composition and Isometric log ratio transform of a (dataset of) composition(s) — compilr

what: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
title: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
text: function obtains estimated marginal means (EMMs) models containing composition outcome

title: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
code: emmcoda(object, specs, at, ...)

title: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
text: specs character vector specifying names predictors EMMs desired. numeric vector passed ref_grid specifying predictor's values EMMs. ... arguments passed emmeans. data fitted mvmcoda model data. Required.

title: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
text: list four elements.

title: Estimated marginal means of composition. — emmcoda
code: emtest <- emmcoda(object = mvm1, specs = "STRESS", at = c(1:10)) #> Error in copy(object): object 'mvm1' not found

title: Multilevel Compositional Data — mcompd
text: simulated dataset containing multiple days compositional data.

title: Multilevel Compositional Data — mcompd
code: mcompd

title: Multilevel Compositional Data — mcompd
text: data table containing 9 variables. TST Total Sleep Time (minutes) --- repeated measure WAKE Wake time bed, trying sleep (minutes) --- repeated measure MVPA Moderate Vigorous Physical Activity (minutes) --- repeated measure LPA Light Physical Activity (minutes) --- repeated measure SB Sedentary Behavior (minutes) --- repeated measure ID unique identifier individual Age Age years --- baseline measure Female Binary: whether participants identified female (1) (0) --- baseline measure STRESS Self report stress measures 0 10 scale --- repeated measure

what: A series of functions for single level multivariate compositional models — mvcoda
title: A series of functions for single level multivariate compositional models — mvcoda
text: Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate compositional model via full Bayesian inference using Stan, composition outcome.

title: A series of functions for single level multivariate compositional models — mvcoda
code: mvcoda(data, formula, sbp, composition, ...)

title: A series of functions for single level multivariate compositional models — mvcoda
text: data data.frame data.table containing data variables used analysis. must include composition ID variable. Required. formula object class brmsformula, mvbrmsformula: symbolic description model fitted. sbp signary matrix indicating sequential binary partition. Required. Details model specification can found mvbrmsformula. composition character vector specifying names compositional variables. Required. ... arguments passed brm.

title: A series of functions for single level multivariate compositional models — mvcoda
code: data(mcompd) data(sbp) ## run mvcoda mv1 <- mvcoda(mcompd, mvbind(ilr1, ilr2, ilr3, ilr4) ~ STRESS + Age + Female, sbp, c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB")) #> Setting 'rescor' to TRUE by default for this model #> Warning: In the future, 'rescor' will be set to FALSE by default for all models. It is thus recommended to explicitely set 'rescor' via 'set_rescor' instead of using the default. #> Compiling Stan program... #> Start sampling #>  #> SAMPLING FOR MODEL '073d2acfbbf1bc2d11a2ffeca886b15c' NOW (CHAIN 1). #> Chain 1:  #> Chain 1: Gradient evaluation took 0.004737 seconds #> Chain 1: 1000 transitions using 10 leapfrog steps per transition would take 47.37 seconds. #> Chain 1: Adjust your expectations accordingly! what:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the outcome. — mvmcoda
title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the outcome. — mvmcoda
text: function utilises

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the outcome. — mvmcoda
code: mvmcoda(compilr, formula, ...)

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the outcome. — mvmcoda
text: compilr compilr object containing data composition, ILR coordinates, variables used model. formula object class brmsformula, mvbrmsformula: symbolic description model fitted. Details model specification can found mvbrmsformula. ... arguments passed brm.

title:
Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multivariate multilevel compositional model
via full Bayesian inference using Stan,
when composition is the outcome. — mvmcoda
code: data(mcompd) data(sbp) cilr <- compilr(data = mcompd, sbp = sbp) #> Error in isFALSE(identical(length(composition), ncol(sbp))): argument "composition" is missing, with no default  ## inspect names of ILR coordinates bfore passing to 'brm' model names(cilr$TotalILR) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'cilr' not found  ## run mvmcoda mvm <- mvmcoda(compilr = cilr, formula = mvbind(ilr1, ilr2, ilr3, ilr4) ~ STRESS + (1 | ID),                 chains = 4, cores = 8) #> Please be patient, mvmcoda is working hard... #> Error in cbind(compilr$data, compilr$TotalILR): object 'cilr' not found

title: Possible Pairwise Substitution — possub
code: data(mcompd)  ps1 <- possub(data = mcompd, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB")) ps2 <- possub(data = mcompd, composition = c("WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"))  print(s2) #> Error in print(s2): object 's2' not found  ## cleanup rm(mcompd, ps1, ps2) #> Warning: object 'mcompd' not found

title: A series of functions for single level compositional models — subcoda
code: subcoda(data, composition, sbp, formula, minute, substitute, ...)

title: A series of functions for single level compositional models — subcoda
text: data composition dataset composition. Required. composition string character indicating names compositional variables data. sbp signary matrix indicating sequential binary partition. Required. ... arguments passed brm.

title: A series of functions for single level compositional models — subcoda
text: list seven elements. BrmsModel object class brmsfit, contains posterior draws along many useful information model. SubstitutionResults list containing result isotemporal substitution model compositional variable. ILR Isometric log ratio transform composition. CompA vector class acomp representing one composition matrix class acomp representing multiple closed compositions one row. data user's dataset imputed dataset input data contains zeros. sbp user-defined sequential binary partition matrix. composition Names compositional variables. subcoda function wraps series workflows follow: function firstly compute composition ILR coordinates, fit Bayesian single-level compositional model compositional predictors users' choices outcomes covariates. Finally, computes isotemporal compositional substitution model according user's desired time period. data(mcompd) data(sbp)davg <- mcompd[, .(SB = mean(SB, na.rm = TRUE),                    LPA = mean(LPA, na.rm = TRUE),                    MVPA = mean(MVPA, na.rm = TRUE),                    TST = mean(TST, na.rm = TRUE),                    WAKE = mean(WAKE, na.rm = TRUE),                    TRESS = mean(STRESS, na.rm = TRUE),                    Age = mean (Age, na.rm = TRUE),                    Female = na.omit(Female)[1]),                    = .(ID)]scoda <- subcoda(data = davg, composition = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"),                         sbp = sbp, minute = 10, substitute = posubtest,                        formula = STRESS ~ ilr1 + ilr2 + ilr3 + ilr4) ## cleanup  rm(mcompd, sbp, davg, scoda)

title: Margianl Effects of Within-person Substitution — wsubmargins
code: data(sbp) data (mcompd)  ps <- possub(count = 5, data = mcompd[, 1:6], idvar = "ID") #> Error in possub(count = 5, data = mcompd[, 1:6], idvar = "ID"): unused arguments (count = 5, idvar = "ID")  ## add object - change name to data  wsubmarginstest <- wsubmargins(data = mcm, substitute = ps, minute = 10) #> Error in copy(data): object 'mcm' not found
